plantuml_diagram:
@startuml
!define AWSPuml https://raw.githubusercontent.com/awslabs/aws-icons-for-plantuml/v20.0/dist
!include AWSPuml/AWSCommon.puml

title High-Level Deployment Architecture (Flask on Kubernetes with Jenkins CI/CD)

skinparam shadowing false
skinparam componentStyle rectangle
skinparam wrapWidth 220
skinparam maxMessageSize 120

actor "Developer" as dev

node "Jenkins Server\n(CI/CD)" as jenkins {
  artifact "Source Repo\n(Git)" as git
  component "Pipeline\n(Jenkinsfile)" as pipeline
  component "Build & Test\nDocker build + pytest + flake8" as buildtest
  component "Push Image\ndocker push" as push
  component "Deploy\nkubectl apply" as deploy
}

cloud "Docker Hub\n(Container Registry)" as registry

node "Kubernetes Cluster\n(Minikube / Generic K8s)" as k8s {
  node "Worker Nodes" as workers {
    node "Kubernetes Deployment\nreplicas=3" as k8sdeploy {
      node "Pod (x3)" as pods {
        artifact "Container: Flask App\nPython + Flask\nListens on :5000" as app
      }
    }
  }
  component "Kubernetes Service\nType: NodePort\nPort 5000" as svc
}

actor "User" as user

dev --> git : commit/push
pipeline --> git : checkout
pipeline --> buildtest
buildtest --> push
push --> registry : push image\n${DOCKER_HUB_REPO}

deploy --> k8s : apply manifests\n(deployment.yaml, service.yaml)
registry --> k8sdeploy : image pull
svc --> app : routes traffic
user --> svc : HTTP request\n(NodePort)

note right of deploy
Deployment can be triggered by Jenkins\nusing kubectl against Minikube\nor a target Kubernetes cluster.
end note

note bottom of app
Container built from Dockerfile:\n- flask\n- pytest\n- flake8
end note

@enduml

architecture_description:
## High-level architecture

### Runtime (Kubernetes)
- **Flask Web Application (Python + Flask)**
  - Packaged as a **Docker container** (built from `Dockerfile`).
  - Exposes HTTP on **port 5000**.
- **Kubernetes Deployment**
  - Runs the Flask container as **3 replicas** (`deployment.yaml`) for basic horizontal scaling and availability.
- **Kubernetes Service (NodePort)**
  - Exposes the app externally via **NodePort** on **port 5000** (`service.yaml`).
  - Routes incoming traffic to the set of pod replicas.

### Delivery (CI/CD)
- **Jenkins CI/CD Pipeline (Groovy Jenkinsfile)**
  - **Checkout** source from Git.
  - **Build & quality gates**: `docker build`, run **pytest** and **flake8** inside the build context.
  - **Publish**: pushes the built image to **Docker Hub** (implied by `DOCKER_HUB_REPO` and `docker push`).
  - **Deploy**: applies Kubernetes manifests using `kubectl apply` (targets **Minikube** per Jenkinsfile, but works for any K8s cluster).

### Key relationships / flow
1. Developer commits code to Git.
2. Jenkins pipeline checks out code, builds the Docker image, runs tests/lint.
3. Jenkins pushes the image to Docker Hub.
4. Jenkins deploys to Kubernetes by applying `deployment.yaml` and `service.yaml`.
5. Kubernetes pulls the image from Docker Hub and runs **3 pods**.
6. Users access the application through the **NodePort Service**, which load-balances to the pods.
